name: Chicken Kolhapuri
instructions:
prep_step:
- Heat a pan on a low flame. Add red chilies, coriander seeds, cinnamon, cloves, cardamoms, pepper, mace and nutmeg. Roast until golden without burning. If using nutmeg powder, add it in the next step.
- Add coconut, cumin, sesame seeds and poppy seeds. Saute until all the ingredients turn to golden. Do not over roast as the spices will taste bitter.
- Set these aside and cool. Blend spices to a fine powder.
- Meanwhile add fifteen ml oil to a deep pan or pot & heat it.  Add onions & fry/saute them until golden.
- Add chopped ginger garlic and saute without burning until the raw smell goes off. Set these aside to cool.
- Transfer onion and ginger garlic to the spice powder and blend again to a fine powder. It will be slightly oily and lumpy but make sure ginger garlic is ground well.
- Add this masala and turmeric to the chicken. Mix well to marinate. Set this aside for at least 15 mins to overnight (in the refrigerator).
- Pour oil to the same pan and add tomatoes. Sprinkle salt and saute until the tomatoes turn soft.
- Transfer marinated chicken and saute well for 3 to 5 mins on a medium heat, until the masala begin to smell good.
- Add salt to the chicken. Pour hot water just enough to partially cover the chicken. The amount of water to use depends on the kind of chicken, you may start with half cup water.
- Mix well. Add coriander leaves. Regulate the flame to low flame and cook chicken until fully cooked, fork tender. As you cook, add more hot water if the curry turns too thick. If it is too runny, cook uncovered on a slightly higher heat.
- You will also see traces of oil over the curry when it is done. Taste test and add more salt if you want.
- Serve kolhapuri chicken with plain steamed rice, roti or chapati, kachumber, onions slices and lemon wedges.
- Ginger garlic can be substituted with three and three-quarters g ginger paste & three and three-quarters g garlic paste or 1one-half ginger garlic paste.
- Substitute with 5 to 6 whole cashewnuts

name: Veg Kurma Recipe (Vegetable Korma)
instructions:
prep_step:
- Saute for 30 to 60 seconds.
- Fine chop onions & tomatoes. Slit chilli and set aside all of these. Cube the veggies to one-half inch sizes and set aside. Keep the potatoes immersed in a bowl of water until used.
- Make a fine paste of coconut, cashews, roasted chana dal & saunf with 6 tbsps water. If you do not like the flavor of fennel seeds you may skip it. Set aside the kurma paste.
- Heat a pot with oil. Then saute bay leaf, star anise, mace, jeera, cardamoms, cloves and cinnamon until they sizzle.
- Next put in the chopped onions and green chili. Fry until they turn transparent & pink in color.
- Fry ginger garlic paste until the raw smell goes off.
- Next saute tomatoes with salt until mushy and soft.
- Add turmeric, chilli powder, garam masala and coriander leaves. Saute well for 2 to 3 mins until the masala smells really good.
- Transfer the coconut paste and saute for few minutes until the kurma masala smells good.
- Drain the water from potatoes and add them to the pot.
- Next add the other veggies and mix well. Fry for 2 to 3 minutes and then pour water just enough to cover the veggies. Adjust salt if needed.
- Cook until the veggies are cooked. Garnish with coriander leaves.
- Serve veg kurma with chapati, pulao or biryani.
- Press SAUTE button and pour oil to the inner pot of Instant pot.  Add all the whole spices and saute for 30 seconds.
- Next add onions and chili. saute for 3 mins.
- Add ginger garlic and saute for 30 seconds.
- Next add tomatoes and salt. Saute for 1 minute.
- Move the onions and tomatoes to one side. Add the potatoes to the other side.
- Cover with an external lid and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
- Saute all of these for 1 to 2 minutes.
- Add in all the spice powder and saute for 30 to 60 seconds.
- Press CANCEL button and add the coconut paste.
- Add the rest of the veggies and mix well.
- Pour water and deglaze the bottom by scrubbing with a spatula. This releases bits of food stuck there & avoids a burn.
- Taste the water and add more salt if needed.
- Secure the Instant pot with the lid and position the steam release handle/ value to sealing.
- Press PRESSURE COOK button (high pressure) and set the timer to 1 minute.
- After the Instant pot beeps, wait for 1 minute. Then release the pressure manually by moving the steam release value from sealing to venting.
- Give a gentle stir. Vegetable korma will look runny at this stage but will thicken after it cools down a bit.
- Roasted chana dal is also known as fried gram or roasted gram. These are made from black chickpeas which are sand roasted and skinned. These are easily available in Indian stores.
- If using yogurt or curd, make sure you don’t use sour one. Use more spice powders to balance the tang in yogurt.
- Substitute fresh coconut with 2 tbsps of poppy seeds or 6 tbsps of thick coconut milk. If using coconut milk then skip water used for making the paste.
- It is important to keep the size of the potatoes and carrots to half inch.
- If you use larger pieces of the veggies about 1 inch then you will need to increase the cook time to 2 mins.

name: Mushroom Curry (Mushroom Masala)
instructions:
prep_step:
- Fine chop 1 medium yellow onion to make two hundred and forty g chopped (one hundred and twenty g)
- Peel and grate one-half inch ginger knob to make five g grated (or sub with 1two and one-half g ginger garlic paste)
- Peel and mince or grate 3 medium garlic cloves to make five g
- Puree 3 medium (two hundred and eighty g) ripe tomatoes in a blender to make 1sixty g puree (or use seventy nine and 0.2 g canned tomato puree or 2one-half tbsps. tomato paste mixed with sixty ml water, no citric acid included)
- Soak 20 cashew nuts in sixty ml hot water for 10 mins and grind to a smooth puree/ cream or use two hundred and forty ml coconut milk or 1seven and one-half g nut butter or seventy nine and 0.2 ml heavy cream/ double cream
- Fine chop 2 sprigs of coriander leaves/cilantro (mature stalks removed) to make thirty g chopped (to garnish)
- This recipe makes a slightly chunky curry since chopped onions are used but it is creamy. If you want a smooth curry, simply add the sautéed onions to the tomatoes and blend them. But avoid using red onions if you want to puree them.
- Prepare the mushrooms only when you are ready to use them. I usually do that while cooking the onions and tomatoes.
- It is not essential to saute the mushrooms but some kinds of mushrooms won’t taste good without this step. So do what you like.
- If using small mushrooms, you don’t need to trim the stems as they are not woody and fibrous. But if you are using medium to larger mushrooms, trim off the stems as they can taste woody and fibrous. They will remain under cooked in the curry.
- To make the dish nut-free, dairy-free and coconut free, boil one hundred and eighty g (seventy five g) diced onions in four hundred and eighty ml water for 5 mins, drain and puree with the tomatoes. You will still use chopped onions. It will taste good but won’t have the creamy taste.
- whole spices (optional 1 bay leaf, two and one-half g cumin seeds, 2 green cardamoms, 2 inch cinnamon piece)
- Omit this step for a nut-free version . Soak cashews in sixty ml hot water & grind to a smooth cream/ puree. (Alternately you may blend the cashews and tomatoes together if you want.)
- Heat oil or ghee in a pan and add the whole spices, followed by onions.
- Saute until golden, for about 9 to 10 mins. Stir in the ginger and garlic. Saute for a minute and pour thirty ml water to deglaze the pan.
- Stir in red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, salt and garam masala.
- Add tomato puree and cook down till it becomes thick and smells aromatic.
- Pour cashew puree and hot water (or coconut milk). Mix well and bring to a rolling boil on a high heat. Reduce heat and cook covered until the onions are soft and the gravy turns thick.
- Add seven and one-half ml ghee to another pan and add the sliced or quartered mushrooms. Stir fry until aromatic for 4 to 5 mins and transfer them to the thick curry.
- Cook covered until the mushrooms are completely tender to your liking. If the masala is too thick add a splash of water.
- Add kasuri methi and more salt or garam masala as needed. If your curry is too tart, add little sugar or maple syrup. (If you use heavy cream stir in here)
- Sprinkle lemon juice at the time of serving and garnish with coriander leaves. Serve mushroom curry over rice or with flatbreads – roti, chapati, plain paratha or naan.
- I use fresh shiitake or white button mushrooms in this recipe. White button mushrooms shrink a lot, so you can use upto 1 pound in this recipe.
- If using canned tomato sauce or paste, opt for a no added citric acid product.
- This recipe makes a slightly chunky curry since chopped onions are used but it is creamy. If you want a smooth sauce, simply add the sautéed onions to the tomatoes and puree. But avoid using red onions if you want to puree them.
- If you are not using cashews, use liquid with caution.
- For a nut-free option, use heavy cream or coconut milk. To use coconut milk omit water. To use heavy cream, cook the curry in water and stir in the cream at the last stage.
- If you want you may add 1 bay leaf, two and one-half g cumin seeds, 2 green cardamoms and 2 inch cinnamon stick to the tempering before adding onions.

name: Paneer Tikka Masala Recipe
instructions:
prep_step:
- Place a steel bowl in your curry so it is not immersed in the curry.
- Burn a small piece of natural wood charcoal over direct fire holding it with a tong until red hot. Make sure it burns well so that it can release the smoke.
- Take it away from the candle – place it inside the bowl. Add two and one-half ml ghee or oil.
- Immediately it begins to emit smoke.
- Make sure charcoal is not touching the food. Cover the pan with a lid immediately. Leave it for 5 to 6 minutes. This infuses a smoky flavor to your dish.
- To a mixing bowl, add yogurt, red chili powder, ginger garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric, kasuri methi, oil, lemon juice & salt.
- Mix well and taste test it. Add more salt if required. Add paneer cubes & gently mix well to coat the paneer with the marinade.
- Optional – If using onions & bell peppers, dice them to the same size as that of paneer. Separate the layers in the onion. Add them along with bell pepper and marinate gently. Set this aside until the gravy is done.
- Heat half of the oil and add the chopped onions. Saute them well until transparent or golden on a medium heat.
- Add tomatoes, cashews, sugar and salt. Saute all of these well until the tomatoes turn mushy and soft.
- Stir in  red chilli powder & garam masala, Saute for another 2 mins, until the masala smells good & aromatic.
- Cool this completely and add to a blender.  Pour water and blend to a smooth puree.
- Heat the rest of the oil in a pan on a low flame and add the whole spices. When they sizzle, add ginger garlic paste & saute for 1 to 2 mins, until the raw smell disappears.
- Pour the onion tomato puree. (Careful as it may splash). At this step, taste test and add more red chilli powder if you want to achieve a brighter color.
- Pour water to bring this to a gravy consistency. Cook covered until the gravy turns thick for about 10 mins and you see traces of oil on top. Keep stirring in between.
- Once the gravy is thick yet of a pouring consistency, you may remove and discard the whole spices. Crush the kasuri methi in your palms and sprinkle it. (optional). Taste the gravy & add more salt if needed. Rest this aside.
- Option 1 – Grill in oven . Preheat the oven to 430 F or 220 C for at least 15 mins. Line a baking tray with foil. Thread paneer, onion & bell peppers alternately on skewers. Place the skewers in the baking tray & grill for 8 to 10 minutes, turning them to the other side after 5 mins. Remove them when golden and crisp.
- Option 2 – To make on griddle . Heat a tsp oil in a wide pan on a high flame, coat each paneer piece with the marinade & place on the griddle. Cook on a high flame till the marinade dries up and paneer turns golden. Similarly place the bell peppers and marinated onions and fry until the marinade dries up.
- Option 3 – Air fryer. If your air fryer needs preheating, you may preheat it for 5 mins first. Thread paneer, onion, bell pepper on skewers. Air fry the skewers placed in a tray at 390 F or 200 C for 5 mins. Brush them with the marinade and then air fry for another 2 mins. The marinade has to partially dried up. Also adjust the air fryer time as needed.
- Transfer grilled paneer tikka along with veggies & onions to the tikka masala gravy.
- Pour the cream. Gently mix. Garnish with cream and coriander leaves.
- Serve paneer tikka masala with Roti, Butter Naan, Basmati Rice or Jeera rice
- Yogurt: This recipe needs thick curd also known as Hung curd or greek yogurt which is strained yogurt. If you do not have thick curd make your own by adding around 1one hundred and twenty g plain homemade yogurt or curd to a thin muslin cloth or a clean handkerchief. Tie it up. Hang it in the refrigerator for about 2 to 4 hours. Use only one hundred and twenty g of the hung yogurt for this recipe.
- Runny Marinade: If your marinade it runny, you need to fix it else it drip all over the pan when you grill the tikkas. To fix runny marinade, you may add fifteen g gram flour/ besan or sattu (roasted chana dal flour)
- Nut-free Option: You may substitute the nuts with more heavy cream. Instead of 3 tbsps add 6 to one hundred and twenty ml cream. Alternately you may skip the nuts completely, the dish will still taste good. White poppy seeds, sunflower seeds and melon seeds (magaz) are the close substitutes. Make sure you don’t use rancid seeds as these substitutes go rancid very fast even during their shelf period.
- Onions & Bell Peppers: You can skip onions and bell peppers for the tikka. But grilled onions and pepper lend a nice flavor to the curry.
- Vegan option: Use tofu in place of paneer and add more cashews and skip the cream. Use vegan yogurt for the marinade.

name: Paneer Do Pyaza
instructions:
prep_step:
- Make a fine puree of capsicum, tomatoes and cashews. Set this aside.
- Add oil to a pan and heat it.
- Add jeera and cardamoms.
- When they splutter, add chopped onions.
- Fry until they turn golden.
- Add ginger garlic paste and fry until the raw smell of ginger garlic goes away.
- Pour the tomato puree and saute on a low to medium flame.
- Within minutes the mixture begins to leave the pan.
- Add salt, red chili powder, garam masala and coriander powder.
- Saute till oil separates. After frying the mixture for few minutes, oil begins to ooze out.
- Pour water and mix well.
- Cook covered until the gravy thickens. Traces of oil would be seen on the gravy.
- Lower the flame completely. Add paneer and sprinkle crushed kasuri methi.
- Cook covered just for 2 to 3 mins. Turn off the stove. Do not overcook the paneer.
- Meanwhile add 1 to 1.seventy five ml oil or ghee to a hot pan. Fry onions and green chiles on a high flame just for 2 to 3 mins. The onions must be partially cooked but must retain the crunch.
- Pour this over the paneer gravy and sprinkle some corainder leaves. You can set aside few onions for garnish.
- Paneer do pyaza is ready to serve.

- Cook covered until the gravy thickens. Traces of oil would be seen on the gravy.
- Lower the flame completely. Add paneer and sprinkle crushed kasuri methi.
- Cook covered just for 2 to 3 mins. Turn off the stove. Do not overcook the paneer.
- Meanwhile add 1 to 1.seventy five ml oil or ghee to a hot pan. Fry onions and green chiles on a high flame just for 2 to 3 mins. The onions must be partially cooked but must retain the crunch.
- Pour this over the paneer gravy and sprinkle some corainder leaves. You can set aside few onions for garnish.
- Paneer do pyaza is ready to serve.

name: Masala Dosa
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds together for 6-8 hours or overnight.
- Grind the soaked ingredients into a smooth batter and ferment it overnight.
- Boil, peel, and mash the potatoes.
- Chop onions, green chilies, ginger, and curry leaves finely.

quick_step:
- Soak and ferment rice and urad dal batter overnight.
- Prepare spiced mashed potato filling by sautéing onions, chilies, and spices.
- Spread fermented batter thinly on a hot pan to make crispy dosa.
- Add potato filling, fold dosa, and serve hot with chutney and sambar.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
- Add chopped onions, green chilies, ginger, and curry leaves; sauté until onions are translucent.
- Add turmeric powder and mashed potatoes; mix well and cook for a few minutes to make the potato filling.
- Heat a non-stick pan or tawa, pour a ladle of dosa batter and spread it thinly in a circular motion.
- Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until the dosa turns golden and crispy.
- Place a portion of the potato filling on one side of the dosa and fold it over.
- Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

name: Idli Sambar
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil the ground garlic in some water until cooked.
- Chop the onion, tomato, carrots, and boil the potatoes separately and chop them.
- Prepare tamarind water by soaking tamarind in hot water and straining.

quick_step:
- Boil garlic and prepare tamarind water.
- Sauté mustard seeds, fenugreek, red chillies, asafoetida, curry leaves, and onions.
- Add vegetables and tamarind water along with spices and jaggery.
- Simmer the sambar for 15-20 minutes until cooked and flavorful.
- Serve hot with idlis.

cook_step:
- Heat mustard oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and red chillies.
- Add a pinch of asafoetida and curry leaves, then sauté chopped onions until translucent.
- Add chopped tomatoes, carrots, and boiled potatoes, sauté briefly.
- Add salt, boiled tamarind water, and enough water to maintain consistency.
- Add red chili powder, sambar masala, and jaggery; mix well.
- Let the sambar simmer for 15-20 minutes with the lid on until flavors meld.

name: Greek Yogurt Bowl
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and slice fresh berries if needed.
- Measure out Greek yogurt, honey, nuts, and seeds.

quick_step:
- Spoon Greek yogurt into a bowl.
- Top with fresh berries, nuts, and chia seeds.
- Enjoy immediately as a healthy breakfast or snack.

name: Filter Coffee Recipe (South Indian Coffee)
instructions:
prep_step:
- Take the coffee filter. Fit the top vessel on the lower one. Now take fifteen g ground coffee and place it in the vessel with the perforations.
- Gently spread and even out the coffee powder with your fingers or with a small spoon.
- Place the pressing disc with the handle on the coffee powder.
- Heat two hundred and forty ml water in a sauce pan and let it come to a boil.
- When the water comes to a boil, gently pour the water in the top vessel, till its three-quarters or almost full.
- Cover with the lid. Wait for 10 to 12 minutes till the coffee decoction percolates in the lower vessel.
- When all of the coffee is brewed, then heat one hundred and eighty g full fat or whole milk till it becomes hot and boils.
- Now take a tumbler (glass) and add ten g sugar in it.
- Add one-quarter to seventy nine and 0.2 ml hot boiling milk directly in the tumbler (glass) while straining it. I strain milk, so as to avoid the malai that comes with the boiling milk. If you like malai (clotted cream), then you can add milk without straining it. You can add less or more milk as per your preference.
- Now pour sixty g or seventy nine and 0.2 g of the brewed coffee. You can add less or more or as much as you like.
- Now take dabarah or davara. This is a small pan shaped vessel that is used to cool the coffee. The coffee is poured back and forth from the tumbler to the davara and so on. Thus the sugar dissolves and a top layer of foam forms on the coffee. Pour the coffee from the tumbler from a height in the davara.
- Now pour the coffee from the davara back in the tumbler.
- Repeat again pouring coffee in the davara from the tumbler and vice versa. You can do this process 2 to 3 times. Don't do too much as then the coffee becomes cold. You can even skip this step if you want.
- Repeat this method with the remaining servings of the coffee to make it frothy.
- Serve filter coffee hot. It needs to be served immediately as soon as its made.

name: Cold Coffee Recipe (Iced Coffee)
instructions:
prep_step:
- In a blender take your instant coffee, raw sugar, add warm water.
- Blend for a minute or until the coffee solution becomes frothy and the brown color lightens a bit.
- Add 6 to 7 ice cubes. For a thick cold coffee, you can reduce the ice cubes from 2 to 4.
- Pour four hundred and eighty ml cold milk.
- Whole milk gives a slightly thicker consistency and is richer. You can opt to make the cold coffee with skimmed milk or low-fat milk. If you decided to add either, then reduce the sixty ml water to about 2 to forty five g.
- Blend for 1 to 2 minutes or until the milk is mixed evenly with the coffee concoction and you see a nice frothy layer on top.
- Pour in glasses and serve cold coffee. The frothy top layer will settle into the beverage as it sits, so it’s best to enjoy blended iced coffee right away.

name: Badam Milk Recipe (Creamy Indian Almond Drink)
instructions:
prep_step:
- Rinse and then soak almonds in seventy nine and 0.2 ml hot boiling water. Cover and keep aside for 30 to 40 minutes.
- Later drain all the water and peel the almonds.
- You just need to press the skin and it comes out easily.
- Add the peeled almonds in a sturdy blender or grinder jar.
- Then add sixty g sugar or add as required, seeds from 4 green cardamoms and 1 pinch saffron. Saffron is optional and can be skipped.
- Add one-quarter to seventy nine and 0.2 ml milk. Milk can be cold or at room temperature.
- Blend or grind to a fine or superfine consistency. The almonds should be ground very well to a smooth and fine consistency. If there are coarse particles or chunks, then it can be irritating to the throat.
- Pour the ground almond mixture in a saucepan.
- Add the remaining one hundred and twenty ml milk in the blender or grinder jar. Shake and swirl the grinder jar so that almond paste attached to the sides and bottom of the jar gets mixed with the milk and nothing gets wasted.
- Add this milk to the saucepan.
- Lastly add remaining 1.one thousand two hundred ml milk into the saucepan. Mix well.
- Keep the pan on a low flame and begin to heat the milk.
- Stir at intervals so that the milk does not scorch from the bottom.
- You just need to heat the milk and there is no need for a vigorous boil. A light boil is also fine. Switch off the heat when the milk becomes hot.
- Serve badam milk hot or warm. It can be chilled also and then served. If you want you can add a touch of rose water in the milk.
- Alternatively you can even garnish Badam Milk with rose petals. Sliced blanched almonds can also be used as a garnish as well as a few strands of saffron.

name: Poha
instructions:
prep_step:
- Rinse the flattened rice (poha) in a colander under running water and drain well.
- Chop the onions, green chilies, and coriander leaves.
- Juice the lemon.

quick_step:
- Rinse and drain poha.
- Sauté mustard seeds, onions, and chilies.
- Add spices and poha; cook briefly.
- Finish with lemon juice and coriander.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds; let them splutter.
- Add chopped onions and green chilies; sauté until onions turn translucent.
- Add turmeric powder and salt; mix well.
- Add the drained poha to the pan and gently mix to combine with the spices.
- Cook for 2-3 minutes until poha is heated through.
- Turn off the heat and add lemon juice and chopped coriander leaves; mix gently.

name: Perfect Upma
instructions:
prep_step:
- Finely chop onions, capsicum, green chilies, ginger, and coriander leaves.
- Measure and keep all dals, spices, semolina, and nuts ready.

quick_step:
- Roast dals and cashew nuts in ghee and set aside.
- Roast semolina until aromatic and set aside.
- Tempering with mustard seeds, dals, asafoetida, and curry leaves.
- Sauté onions, capsicum, chilies, and spices.
- Boil water and gradually add semolina to avoid lumps.
- Cook covered until done, then add ghee, lemon juice, coriander, and nuts.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pan and fry moong dal and cashew nuts until golden; remove and set aside.
- Roast semolina in ghee until aromatic and lightly golden; remove and set aside.
- In the same pan, add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, asafoetida, and curry leaves; sauté until dals turn golden.
- Add chopped onions, capsicum, and green chilies; sauté until onions turn translucent.
- Add ginger, green peas, black pepper powder, salt, and sugar; mix well and cook for a minute.
- Add seven hundred and twenty ml of water and bring it to a boil.
- Slowly add roasted semolina little by little, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
- Cover and cook on low heat for 2 minutes until water is absorbed and upma is cooked.
- Add ten ml ghee, lemon juice, chopped coriander, and fried cashew nuts; mix gently and serve hot.

name: Aloo Paratha
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil and mash the potatoes until smooth.
- Mix mashed potatoes with salt and spices as desired.
- Knead the wheat flour with water to make a soft dough and let it rest.
- Divide the dough and potato mixture into equal portions.
- Make round balls from the dough and the potato filling.

quick_step:
- Prepare and mash the potato filling with spices.
- Make dough from wheat flour and water.
- Stuff dough balls with potato mixture and roll out carefully.
- Cook on a hot skillet with ghee until golden and crisp.
- Serve hot with curd, butter, and accompaniments.

cook_step:
- Roll out a dough ball slightly, place the potato filling in the center, and seal it properly.
- Gently roll out the stuffed dough ball into a flat circle, taking care not to let the filling spill out.
- Heat a tawa or skillet and cook the paratha on medium heat until golden brown spots appear on both sides.
- Apply ghee on both sides while cooking for a rich flavor and crisp texture.
- Remove from heat and serve hot with curd, butter, and soya or pickles.

name: Chilli Paneer Paratha
instructions:
prep_step:
- Grate the paneer and finely chop the mixed vegetables and green chillies.
- Mix grated paneer, chopped vegetables, green chilli, ginger-garlic paste, red chilli powder, garam masala, and salt to prepare the stuffing.
- In a bowl, combine whole wheat flour with some grated vegetables to knead a soft dough using water.

quick_step:
- Prepare dough by mixing whole wheat flour with grated vegetables and knead with water.
- Make the chilli paneer stuffing by combining grated paneer, chopped vegetables, and spices.
- Stuff the dough balls with the paneer mixture and roll into parathas.
- Cook parathas on a hot pan without oil, adding ghee or butter after cooking.
- Serve warm for a healthy breakfast.

cook_step:
- Divide the dough into equal portions and roll out a small circle.
- Place a portion of the chilli paneer stuffing in the center of the rolled dough.
- Fold the dough over the stuffing and seal the edges, then gently roll out into a paratha.
- Cook the paratha on a hot pan without adding ghee or oil initially, flipping until both sides are cooked and slightly crispy.
- Serve hot with a dollop of ghee or butter on top.

name: Chicken Chettinad Gravy Recipe
instructions:
prep_step:
- Bone-in chicken is favored for the extra flavor the bones produce. Traditionally, whole chicken that’s cut-up to smaller portions (curry-cut) is used. But if you don’t prefer that, you may use boneless chicken breast or thighs that are cut up to 1one-half inch portions. Cut down the cook time else they can dry out & overcook.
- You can make the dry spice blend without coconut to store for 3 months in the refrigerator or for 1 month at room temperature.
- You can make the Chettinad masala paste ahead and refrigerate for a week. Beyond the mentioned time, the spice blend begins to lose the flavors.
- Traditionally chicken is not marinated, but I prefer to do that as it removes the poultry smell. Yogurt or lemon juice helps do that and the spices in the marinade season the chicken well at this stage.
- Chettinad curry is not a tomato based curry, so you may cut down the amount of tomatoes if you want.
- It is essential to grind the spices super smooth else you will find the gravy gritty. Chicken cooks faster than mutton, so the gravy won’t get a lot of time to cook down & soften the grits.
- Marinate chicken with chili powder, turmeric, salt, ginger garlic and lemon juice or yogurt. Cover and rest aside until needed.
- To a pan, add red chilies, cinnamon, cloves, star anise, dagad phool, black pepper corn, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, coriander seeds and cardamoms.
- Heat on a medium flame for 2 mins. Reduce to low and roast until crunchy and golden, for 7 to 8 mins. Do not burn and keep stirring constantly. Remove to cool down.
- Add coconut, half of the curry leaves and half tablespoon oil to the same pan and roast until light golden, for 7 to 8 mins. Turn off.
- Transfer all the roasted spices and make a fine powder. Your chettinad masala is ready. To make the paste, add coconut, curry leaves and cashews if using to the same grinder jar. Pour half cup cold water and make a super smooth paste. This is Chettinad masala paste.
- Heat oil in a pan, add bay leaf (optional) and onions. Saute until the onions turn light golden, for 7 to 8 mins.
- Add the chicken and fry on a high heat for at least 4 to 5 mins.
- Stir in the tomatoes. (and red chili powder if using). Saute until the raw smell of tomatoes is gone and the oil begins to ooze out of the tomatoes.
- Stir in the rest of the curry leaves and transfer the ground Chettinad masala paste and hot water.
- Mix well and simmer covered until the chicken is cooked through. A meat thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the chicken should read 165 F or 75 C.
- Taste test and adjust salt to your liking. If the gravy is runny, evaporate some of the liquid by cooking on a high heat.
- Serve chicken chettinad gravy with rice, chapatti, idli, dosa and appam.
- If you prefer a low-heat dish, I highly recommend substituting dried red chilies with Kashmiri red chili powder. Sometimes whole chilies can make your dish super hot.
- Either add the chili powder to the grinder when you grind the masala or add it to the pan directly when you add the tomatoes.
- If you love your dish to be bright in color like seen in the pictures, use 1/4 to half teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder and cut down the dried chilies.

name: Vegetable Sandwich
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop capsicum, carrots, cucumber, and tomato into small pieces.
- Mix the chopped vegetables with black pepper powder, salt, and mayonnaise until well combined.

quick_step:
- Chop vegetables and mix with mayonnaise, salt, and pepper.
- Butter the bread slices on both sides.
- Spread the vegetable mixture on one slice and top with another slice.
- Cut and serve immediately.

cook_step:
- Apply butter on both sides of the bread slices.
- Spread the vegetable mixture evenly on one buttered bread slice.
- Place the other buttered bread slice on top to form a sandwich.
- Cut the sandwich into desired shapes and serve.

name: Indian Egg Bhurji
instructions:
prep_step:
- Finely chop the red onion, green chili, tomatoes, and fresh cilantro.
- Crack the eggs into a bowl, add a pinch of salt, and whisk well.

quick_step:
- Heat ghee and caramelize onions.
- Toast cumin seeds and add green chili.
- Add ginger garlic paste and spices.
- Cook tomatoes until soft.
- Add whisked eggs and cook gently.
- Garnish with cilantro and optional cheese.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pan until melted and aromatic.
- Add the chopped red onion and cook on medium heat until caramelized and softened.
- Toast cumin seeds in the pan until fragrant.
- Add chopped green chili and toast briefly on medium heat.
- Add ginger garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
- Add garam masala, turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chili powder, and salt; toast the spices briefly.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and start to melt.
- Pour in the whisked eggs and gently mix into the onion-tomato mixture.
- Cook on low heat, stirring gently, until eggs are soft and cooked through.
- Finish by sprinkling fresh cilantro on top and optionally some cheese.

name: Plain Omelette
instructions:
prep_step:
- Crack the eggs into a bowl and beat them until smooth.
- Season the eggs with salt and pepper.

quick_step:
- Beat eggs with salt and pepper.
- Heat butter in pan over medium-high heat.
- Pour eggs into pan and let edges brown.
- Fold edges inward and add cheese.
- Cook until interior is soft and edges have a crust.
- Serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add butter.
- Pour the beaten eggs into the hot pan.
- Allow the edges to brown slightly, then fold the edges inward to cook evenly.
- Add cheese on top before folding the omelette fully.
- Cook just enough so the interior remains soft but the edges develop a light crust.
- Serve immediately, optionally with hot sauce.

name: Masala Omelette
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onions, red, yellow, and green bell peppers, tomatoes, green chili, and coriander leaves.

quick_step:
- Chop all vegetables and coriander.
- Beat eggs with spices and vegetables.
- Melt butter in pan and pour egg mixture.
- Cook and flip the omelette.
- Serve hot.

cook_step:
- Melt butter in a pan over medium heat.
- Add the beaten eggs mixed with chopped vegetables and spices into the pan.
- Cook the eggs until set and then flip to cook the other side until golden brown.
- Remove from heat and serve hot.

name: Rava Kesari
instructions:
prep_step:
- Measure all ingredients and keep them ready.
- Soak saffron strands in a tablespoon of warm water if using saffron.
- Chop or prepare nuts if needed.

quick_step:
- Roast semolina in ghee until aromatic.
- Prepare sugar syrup by dissolving sugar in boiling water.
- Add sugar syrup to roasted semolina and stir continuously.
- Add cardamom and saffron or color, cook until thickened.
- Mix in fried nuts and raisins, then rest before serving.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pan on medium flame.
- Add cashew nuts and raisins and fry until golden, then remove and set aside.
- Add semolina to the hot ghee and roast on low-medium flame until it turns aromatic and slightly golden.
- Boil water separately and add sugar to it, stirring until dissolved.
- Add the hot sugar water to the roasted semolina gradually, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
- Add cardamom powder and saffron water or food color, mix well.
- Cook on low flame until the mixture thickens and leaves the sides of the pan.
- Add fried nuts and raisins, mix gently and turn off the heat.
- Cover and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

name: Brioche French Toast
instructions:
prep_step:
- In a bowl, whisk together milk and eggs until well combined.
- Add cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves to the mixture and stir well.
- Mix in sugar and a dash of vanilla extract.
- Dip brioche bread slices into the custard mixture for about 10 seconds on each side.

quick_step:
- Whisk eggs, milk, spices, sugar, and vanilla to make custard.
- Dip brioche bread slices into custard.
- Cook bread slices in clarified butter on skillet for 7.5 minutes per side.
- Serve topped with fresh berries, syrup, and powdered sugar.

cook_step:
- Heat a skillet over medium heat and coat the bottom with clarified butter.
- Place dipped bread slices onto the skillet and cook for 7 and a half minutes on one side without touching.
- Flip the bread slices and cook for another 7 and a half minutes until golden brown and cooked through.

name: Classic Pancakes
instructions:
prep_step:
- In a large bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
- In another bowl, whisk milk and egg together until combined.
- Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir gently until just combined.
- Add melted butter and mix lightly.

quick_step:
- Mix dry ingredients in a bowl.
- Whisk wet ingredients separately.
- Combine wet and dry ingredients gently.
- Cook batter on a greased pan until golden on both sides.
- Serve warm with toppings of choice.

cook_step:
- Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease it.
- Pour about sixty g of batter onto the pan for each pancake.
- Cook until bubbles form on the surface and edges look set, about 2-3 minutes.
- Flip the pancake and cook for another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.

name: Upgraded Oats Porridge
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop fruits and nuts into bite-sized pieces.
- Prepare orange peel by zesting or finely chopping if fresh.

quick_step:
- Toast oats with salt and spices in a pot.
- Slowly add oat milk and cook while stirring.
- Sweeten with brown sugar and orange peel.
- Top with chopped fruits, nuts, and yogurt before serving.

cook_step:
- Heat a pot over medium heat and add the oats along with salt, cinnamon, and cardamom.
- Toast the oats and spices, stirring frequently until fragrant.
- Gradually add oat milk while stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
- Cook slowly on low heat, adding more oat milk as needed, stirring until the porridge reaches desired creamy consistency.
- Stir in brown sugar and orange peel for added flavor.
- Remove from heat once cooked to preferred thickness.

name: Vegetable Oats Upma
instructions:
prep_step:
- Finely chop the carrot, onion, and roughly chop the green chili.
- Peel and dice the potato into small pieces.
- Roast the oats in a dry pan until the color changes, then cool and set aside.

quick_step:
- Roast oats and set aside.
- Boil water with peas and carrot until parboiled.
- Prepare tadka with mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, green chili, potato, and cashews.
- Sauté onions, then roast semolina and add roasted oats.
- Add boiling vegetable water, cook until absorbed.
- Mix in whisked wheat and curd, season with salt, lemon juice, sugar, and coconut.
- Cook to desired consistency and serve warm.

cook_step:
- Boil 2.one thousand two hundred ml of water and add green peas and chopped carrot; cook until vegetables are parboiled.
- Heat ghee in a pan, add mustard seeds and urad dal; fry until urad dal changes color.
- Add curry leaves, green chili, diced potato, and cashew nuts; sauté briefly.
- Add chopped onions and cook until softened.
- Add semolina and roast for a few minutes, then add the roasted oats.
- Pour in the boiling water with vegetables and stir continuously until water is absorbed and mixture thickens.
- Whisk wheat and curd together and add to the upma; mix well.
- Add salt, lemon juice, a dash of sugar (optional), freshly grated coconut (optional), and curry leaves; mix thoroughly and cook until desired consistency is reached.
- Remove from heat and let it cool slightly before serving.

name: 16 Beetroot Recipes from Indian Cuisine
instructions:
prep_step:
- Just like any other vegetable, root veggies are also an important part of our lives. Out of the entire lot, beetroot or beets are one of those root vegetables that are not really popular with people. But we really can’t ignore the health benefits it has. For the same reason, I have shared my personal favorite collection of 16 Indian Beetroot Recipes here. These Beetroot Recipes include dry preparations (sabji), side dishes, snacks and sweets too.
- Beetroots are rich in iron, calcium and minerals and there are various ways you can include them in your meals. With this compilation, you will be able to dish-up some really simple and easy recipes with this gorgeous looking veggie, at the comfort of your home.
- Like I said, beetroot is a root vegetable having a vibrant crimson & deep red color. It also has a slightly sweet taste with an intense earthy flavor. Usually consumed both for its delicious taste and potential health benefits, its distinctive color comes from pigments called betalains, which also have antioxidant properties.  Beetroot can be eaten raw, cooked or pickled.
- It’s a rich source of essential nutrients, including dietary fiber, vitamins like folate and vitamin C, and minerals like potassium and iron. Additionally, beetroot contains natural compounds called nitrates, which have been associated with potential cardiovascular and exercise performance benefits.
- Beetroots and carrots often make an appearance in our menu. Apart from preparing the Beetroot Recipes listed below, I also add beetroots to pulao/pilaf or mixed vegetable dishes. Due to its versatility and nutritional profile, Indian Beetroot Recipes range from salads, soups and juices to more, and even used as a natural food coloring.
